captions.text:
in today's tutorial i'm going to be showing
you how to create this really easy and gorgeous
princess elsa design from frozen.

begin with a base coat to protect your natural
nails. this will help prevent staining and
it will also adhere the polish to your nail.

to do the ombre nails, paint your nails with
a light blue polish. this will need two or

three coats depending on the opacity of the
polish you are using.

next take a medium blue polish and paint the
corner of a makeup sponge with it. then sponge

it onto the very tip of your nail. once the
the color is solid at the tip, begin sponging
upwards to create a gradient.

quickly take a very fine glitter polish and
apply one coat over the ombre. this will help

blend the two colors together. finally take
a chunky glitter polish and add it to the
tip of the nail and you're finished!

for the elsa nail, begin by painting your
nail white. use two thin coats and allow it

to completely dry before moving on to the
next step. about 10 minutes.

next you're going to need some frozen temporary
tattoos. i got these sheets online for a dollar

each. you can find them on amazon or ebay,
or you could check local toy stores. so today

i'm going to go with this tattoo and cut out
her head. then i'm going to peel off the protective

clear plastic and lay it on top of my nail.
then take a wet cloth or cotton and place

over the tattoo. gently press all over the
nail and give it about 10 seconds to transfer.

remove it and you will be left with a perfect
princess elsa on your nail! if you have any

extra tattoo that goes beyond the tip of your
nail, just gently pull it off.

seal in all of your nail designs with a fast
drying top coat. this will quickly dry your
nails and leave them with a beautiful shine!

and that's it! if you decide to give this
elsa design a try, then please share your

recreations with me on Facebook, instagram,
and twitter using the hashtag #cutepolish!
take care and ill see ya next time :)
